meanings.definition: A person who racks or tortures someone.
meanings.sent1: The rackers in the movie were the villains who enjoyed causing pain.
meanings.sent2: The police officer arrested the rackers who were responsible for the crime.
meanings.sent3: The comedic play featured a clumsy racker who kept accidentally causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp words were like emotional rackers, tormenting him with guilt.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house was filled with ghostly rackers who scared visitors with their tricks.

meanings.definition: A device used for holding or displaying items.
meanings.sent1: She placed the books neatly on the rackers in the library.
meanings.sent2: The shop owner installed new rackers to showcase the latest products.
meanings.sent3: The colorful rackers in the store caught the attention of customers.
meanings.sent4: The rackers in the kitchen kept the spices organized and easily accessible.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed ancient artifacts on ornate rackers for visitors to admire.

meanings.definition: A person who plays the game of racquets.
meanings.sent1: The young racker practiced diligently to improve his skills in the game.
meanings.sent2: The team captain selected the best rackers to compete in the tournament.
meanings.sent3: The enthusiastic racker always brought energy and spirit to the matches.
meanings.sent4: Her swift movements on the court made her a formidable racker to compete against.
meanings.sent5: The coach praised the racker for their dedication and commitment to the sport.
